reviewText: (This review is of the VHS-version) For an hour's length, this movie packs a lot of interesting film footage and illustrations and information about Santa.... and will be interesting for adults and teens who enjoy biographies and love Christmas.  This is the first Christmas movie I watch every year, and I never tire of seeing it!
summary: Concise and Very Interesting Bio of Santa
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS

reviewText: This is a historical recapitulation of the facts and legends that have been modified and combined to create what we now know as Santa Claus. There have been many names for the creature that embodies the holiday spirit. Some of them are Saint Nicolas (Nick), Kris Kringle, Father Christmas and Santa Claus.The legend began in Turkey with the life of a priest called Nicolas. He was a kindly man that worked hard to improve the lives of children and the unfortunate. One legend that I found interesting was based on a man that was too poor to provide a dowry for his daughter. At the time, that meant that she would almost certainly be sold into prostitution or slavery. Taking pity on her, Nicolas wrapped some gold in cloth and dropped it through a window. At the time, people commonly hung their socks on the fireplace overnight to dry and the gold happened to land in a sock. Hence was born the custom of hanging socks on the fireplace so that they will be filled by Santa.It was fascinating to follow the descriptions by historians and experts in folklore as they describe how the legend of Saint Nicolas was expanded and modified to conform to local legends. Most of the development of the legend was evolutionary, yet there were a few times when single events revolutionized how Santa was perceived. One of the most interesting was the origin of the phrase, "Yes Virginia, there is a Santa Claus."
summary: A great historical recapitulation of the legends that evolved into that of Santa Claus
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS

reviewText: A&E;'s Award Winning Series BIOGRAPHY featuring non-other than SANTA CLAUS.This 50 minute color DVD uncovers the real history of this endearing Christian character.  Pieces of todays 'Santa Claus' through this biography are derived from fact, legends, traditional folklore tales from all over Europe, Mideast and North & South Americas.  A very interesting woven tapestry of information about this lovable Christmas Spirit of love and giving.  Even a Patron Saint of children, sailors, merchantmen and more.A very enjoyable and enlightening story.  Very educational and provides many pictures of this jolly old elf.I highly recommend this holiday treat!!  Enjoy!!!
summary: Very Informative DVD presentation, "BIOGRAPHY of SANTA CLAUS" (explained)
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS

reviewText: I got this movie for my 5 year old son because he quit believing in Santa so I was hoping to show him that Saint Nick was a real man at one time so maybe my son would at least know some where it all came from. It showed him a little bit but things need to be explained to him in a different kind of way. This movie basically just kept saying "Maybe Santa is real and maybe he's not." My son Knows hes not real (he's got a mind like a scientist, you have to physically show him things or he just doesn't believe. Everything needs to be proven too him) so this movie just wasn't for him. But I guess it was alright other then the fact it was not what I was looking for.
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS

reviewText: A delightful chronological review of the Santa Claus figure from pre-Christian through St Nicholas and most fascinating, just how the standardized modern Santa evolved to his present form. Great fun and does not destroy the Santa myth since the spirit of Santa is the same whatever he looks like.
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS

reviewText: very interesting research into Santa Clause, learned somethings I did not know. Was very happy with it & fouond it of great interest.
Title: Biography - Santa Claus VHS
